Description: Body sherd of early Chian patterned pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed black (fired red) with two added white bands; exterior: reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces of the sherd make it difficult to determine to what style it belongs. Early patterned chalices have no decoration on either side of the chalice walls.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0340) (phase 2)
